Context:
Yang Guifei (杨贵妃), also known as Yang Yuhuan (杨玉环), was one of the most famous imperial consorts in Chinese history. Her beauty, tragic love story, and dramatic death during the Tang Dynasty have made her a timeless figure in Chinese literature and legend.

Generate an image prompt for this part of the story:

Imagine a scene from Yang Guifei's tragic love story during the Tang Dynasty. The setting is a dimly lit courtyard at the royal palace, with a single candle casting a flickering light on a small table. Yang Guifei sits alone at the table, her elegant dress and long hair cascading down her back, while her tears fall silently onto the tablecloth. In the background, you can hear the sound of footsteps approaching, and a figure appears in the shadows. It is the Emperor, who has come to see Yang Guifei one last time before she is to be sent away to a distant province. He approaches the table cautiously, not wanting to startle her, and places a small bouquet of flowers in front of her. Yang Guifei looks up at him with tear-filled eyes, and in a weak voice, thanks him for his kindness. The Emperor then turns and walks away, leaving Yang Guifei alone once again in the darkness of the courtyard. [end of text]
